title: How to Make a Traditional Tiramisu

steps.headline: Separate the whites from the yolks of 3 large eggs into two different bowls.
steps.description: Use a large bowl for the egg white and a smaller bowl for the yolk. Make sure that none of the yolk gets mixed with the egg white; otherwise the egg whites won't whisk properly.

steps.headline: Whisk the egg yolks with an electronic whisk.
steps.description: Gradually add sugar until the egg yolk becomes thick, creamy, and light yellow.

steps.headline: Put about 500 grams (~12.3 oz.)
steps.description: of Mascarpone Cheese into another bowl. Give it a quick stir to loosen it up. Then, with the electronic whisk, mix the egg yolks and Mascarpone together.

steps.headline: Wash and dry your whisk and then whisk the egg whites until they form firm peaks.
steps.description: Continue to fold the egg whites into the Mascarpone and mix until there are no lumps.

steps.headline: Put that to the side.
steps.description: Make some strong espresso and let it cool. Add almond liqueur if using.

steps.headline: Line a large and fairly deep dish with lady fingers (boudoir biscuits).
steps.description: Pour over two thirds of the coffee mixture.

steps.headline: Put half of your egg mixture over the top of that, followed by a thick dusting of cocoa powder.
steps.description: Use an instant drinking chocolate, if preferred, as it's a little sweeter.

steps.headline: Dip more lady fingers into the rest of your coffee mix (don't worry if you run out; you can just knock up some more).
steps.description: Carefully place them over the top of the cocoa.

steps.headline: Empty the rest of your egg mixture over that and dust with cocoa again.
Leave it in your refrigerator for two hours to set and serve.

text: Separate the whites from the yolks of 3 large eggs into two different bowls. Use a large bowl for the egg white and a smaller bowl for the yolk. Make sure that none of the yolk gets mixed with the egg white; otherwise the egg whites won't whisk properly. Whisk the egg yolks with an electronic whisk. Gradually add sugar until the egg yolk becomes thick, creamy, and light yellow. Put about 500 grams (~12.3 oz.) of Mascarpone Cheese into another bowl. Give it a quick stir to loosen it up. Then, with the electronic whisk, mix the egg yolks and Mascarpone together. Wash and dry your whisk and then whisk the egg whites until they form firm peaks. Continue to fold the egg whites into the Mascarpone and mix until there are no lumps. Put that to the side. Make some strong espresso and let it cool. Add almond liqueur if using. Line a large and fairly deep dish with lady fingers (boudoir biscuits). Pour over two thirds of the coffee mixture. Put half of your egg mixture over the top of that, followed by a thick dusting of cocoa powder. Use an instant drinking chocolate, if preferred, as it's a little sweeter. Dip more lady fingers into the rest of your coffee mix (don't worry if you run out; you can just knock up some more). Carefully place them over the top of the cocoa. Empty the rest of your egg mixture over that and dust with cocoa again.  Leave it in your refrigerator for two hours to set and serve.
